1-year-old.context: The patient is a 1-year-old male with a history of chronic otitis media with effusion and conductive hearing loss refractory to outpatient medical therapy.

chronic otitis media with effusion.context: Preoperative Diagnoses: 1. Chronic otitis media with effusion.   2. Conductive hearing loss.

conductive hearing loss.context: Preoperative Diagnoses: 1. Chronic otitis media with effusion.   2. Conductive hearing loss.

bilateral tympanostomy with myringotomy.context: Procedure Performed: Bilateral tympanostomy with myringotomy tube placement _______ split tube 1.0 mm.

myringotomy tube placement.context: Procedure Performed: Bilateral tympanostomy with myringotomy tube placement _______ split tube 1.0 mm.

tympanostomy.context: Procedure Performed: Bilateral tympanostomy with myringotomy tube placement _______ split tube 1.0 mm.

myringotomy.context: Procedure: The tympanic membrane is then brought into direct visualization with no signs of any gross retracted pockets or cholesteatoma. A myringotomy incision was then made within the posterior inferior quadrant and the middle ear was then suctioned with a #5 suction demonstrating dry contents.

split tube 1.0 mm.context: Procedure Performed: Bilateral tympanostomy with myringotomy tube placement _______ split tube 1.0 mm.

Cortisporin Otic drops.context: Attention was then drawn to the left ear with the head turned to the right and the medium sized ear speculum placed. The external auditory canal was removed off of its cerumen with a #5 suction which led to the direct visualization of the tympanic membrane. The tympanic membrane appeared with no signs of retraction pockets, cholesteatoma or air fluid levels. A myringotomy incision was then made within the posterior inferior quadrant with a myringotomy blade after which a _________ split tube 1.0 mm was then placed with an alligator forcep. After this, the patient had Cortisporin Otic drops followed by cotton balls placed.

cotton balls.context: Attention was then drawn to the left ear with the head turned to the right and the medium sized ear speculum placed. The external auditory canal was removed off of its cerumen with a #5 suction which led to the direct visualization of the tympanic membrane. The tympanic membrane appeared with no signs of retraction pockets, cholesteatoma or air fluid levels. A myringotomy incision was then made within the posterior inferior quadrant with a myringotomy blade after which a _________ split tube 1.0 mm was then placed with an alligator forcep. After this, the patient had Cortisporin Otic drops followed by cotton balls placed.

Ciloxan ear drops.context: The patient will be followed up approximately in one week and was sent home with a prescription for Ciloxan ear drops to be used as directed and with instructions not to get any water in the ears.

water in the ears.context: The patient will be followed up approximately in one week and was sent home with a prescription for Ciloxan ear drops to be used as directed and with instructions not to get any water in the ears.

anesthesia.context: Anesthesia: Total IV general mask airway.

IV general mask airway.context: Anesthesia: Total IV general mask airway.

total IV general mask airway.context: Anesthesia: Total IV general mask airway.

written consent.context: Indications For Procedure: The patient is a 1-year-old male with a history of chronic otitis media with effusion and conductive hearing loss refractory to outpatient medical therapy. After risks, complications, consequences, and questions were addressed with the family, a written consent was obtained for the procedure.

family.context: Indications For Procedure: The patient is a 1-year-old male with a history of chronic otitis media with effusion and conductive hearing loss refractory to outpatient medical therapy. After risks, complications, consequences, and questions were addressed with the family, a written consent was obtained for the procedure.

cerumen.context: Procedure: The Zeiss operative microscope and medium-sized ear speculum were placed and the cerumen from the external auditory canals were removed with a cerumen loop to #5 suction.

retracted pockets.context: Procedure: The tympanic membrane is then brought into direct visualization with no signs of any gross retracted pockets or cholesteatoma.

cholesteatoma.context: Procedure: The tympanic membrane is then brought into direct visualization with no signs of any gross retracted pockets or cholesteatoma.

air fluid levels.context: Procedure: The tympanic membrane appeared with no signs of retraction pockets, cholesteatoma or air fluid levels.

dry contents.context: Procedure: A myringotomy incision was then made within the posterior inferior quadrant and the middle ear was then suctioned with a #5 suction demonstrating dry contents.

Zeiss operative microscope.context: Procedure: The Zeiss operative microscope and medium-sized ear speculum were placed and the cerumen from the external auditory canals were removed with a cerumen loop to #5 suction.

medium-sized ear speculum.context: Procedure: The Zeiss operative microscope and medium-sized ear speculum were placed and the cerumen from the external auditory canals were removed with a cerumen loop to #5 suction.

alligator forcep.context: Procedure: A myringotomy incision was then made within the posterior inferior quadrant with a myringotomy blade after which a _________ split tube 1.0 mm was then placed with an alligator forcep.

myringotomy blade.context: Procedure: A myringotomy incision was then made within the posterior inferior quadrant with a myringotomy blade after which a _________ split tube 1.0 mm was then placed with an alligator forcep.

posterior inferior quadrant.context: Procedure: A myringotomy incision was then made within the posterior inferior quadrant and the middle ear was then suctioned with a #5 suction demonstrating dry contents.

#5 suction.context: Procedure: The tympanic membrane is then brought into direct visualization with no signs of any gross retracted pockets or cholesteatoma. A myringotomy incision was then made within the posterior inferior quadrant and the middle ear was then suctioned with a #5 suction demonstrating dry contents.

cotton.context: Attention was then drawn to the left ear with the head turned to the right and the medium sized ear speculum placed. The external auditory canal was removed off of its cerumen with a #5 suction which led to the direct visualization of the tympanic membrane. The tympanic membrane appeared with no signs of retraction pockets, cholesteatoma or air fluid levels. A myringotomy incision was then made within the posterior inferior quadrant with a myringotomy blade after which a _________ split tube 1.0 mm was then placed with an alligator forcep.
